description: A corruption of I‘d rather or ‘d rather.

entries.meaning: (rare, chiefly in the plural) singular of druthers
examples: The teacher told Martha that she had invited a neighboring planter to send his children to her school, but "he said 'Me & my wife had no eddication, nor any of my gals, but I would rather they never would have any, than go to school with niggers.' So he had his druther!"48

entries.meaning: (US, informal, often jocular) Would rather; would prefer to.
examples: We druther go swimming than go to school.
